title: ✚ Visualization Tools and Resources, January 2025 Roundup
description: Here are things you can use, poke at, and learn from that bubbled up this past month.Tags: roundup
author: Nathan Yau
excerpt: Here are things you can use, poke at, and learn from that bubbled up this past month.
text: This is the Process, the newsletter for FlowingData members about the steps and choices to get from raw data to publication-level data graphics. I’m Nathan Yau. Every month, I collect tools and resources to help make the job easier. This is the good stuff for January. To access this issue of The Process, you must be a member. (If you are already a member, log in here.) The Process is a weekly newsletter on how visualization tools, rules, and guidelines work in practice. I publish every Thursday. Get it in your inbox or read it on FlowingData. You also gain unlimited access to hundreds of hours worth of step-by-step visualization courses and tutorials, which will help you make sense of data for insight and presentation. Resources include source code and datasets so that you can more easily apply what you learn in your own work. Your support keeps the rest of FlowingData open and assures the data keeps flowing freely.
html:
This is the Process, the newsletter for FlowingData members about the steps and choices to get from raw data to publication-level data graphics. I’m Nathan Yau. Every month, I collect tools and resources to help make the job easier. This is the good stuff for January.

To access this issue of The Process, you must be a member. (If you are already a member, log in here.)

The Process is a weekly newsletter on how visualization tools, rules, and guidelines work in practice. I publish every Thursday. Get it in your inbox or read it on FlowingData.

You also gain unlimited access to hundreds of hours worth of step-by-step visualization courses and tutorials, which will help you make sense of data for insight and presentation. Resources include source code and datasets so that you can more easily apply what you learn in your own work.

Your support keeps the rest of FlowingData open and assures the data keeps flowing freely.
